text: W. Paul White (born July 7, 1945 in Cambridge, Massachusetts) is an American political politician. ==Career== He who was a member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives from 1973 to 1989 from Dorchester, and the Massachusetts Senate from 1989 to 1999. White served as the House Majority Leader in 1984 and the Second Assistant Majority Leader in the Senate from 1995 to 1996. He resigned from the Senate on October 1, 1997 to become Associate Vice President at Boston College. Since 2001, he has been a principal at the Karol Group, Inc., a Boston government relations firm. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Politicians from Boston Category:Boston College alumni Category:Suffolk University Law School alumni Category:John F. Kennedy School of Government alumni Category:Massachusetts Democrats Category:Living people Category:Members of the Massachusetts House of Representatives
title: W. Paul White
